title: Unit 5 Lesson 4: Convolution/Stencil Code in MPI
description: In this lesson the convolution/Stencil algorithm will be introduced. The implementation for the 5 stencil <u>serial</u> code applied to a simple heat transfer simulation will be presented and profiled. The lesson will explain at a high level how to solve and accelerate the code in MPI with a timing comparison of serial vs distributed graphs; the code can be run on a laptop, and shows how to run on a cluster assuming access to Blue Waters or a supercomputer. The lesson is followed by an activity about changing the code to 3D . The code will also be in OpenMP (different unit) so their execution time can be compared.
